sense.name: the act of surrendering or losing something of value
sense.examples: His parents made a lot of sacrifices to send him to college. Mary is prepared to make sacrifices to advance her career. The shady venture was not worth the sacrifice of his good name. These holidays are to honor the sacrifices made by the armed forces. (their acts)

sense.name: personnel lost in battle to attain an objective
sense.commentary: SACRIFICE[+entity][+personnel][+military][+killed] Note: refers to the people, not their acts. (Sense 1)
sense.examples: The general said the sacrifices would be too great in a full-fleged land invasion. The troops incurred enormous sacrifices to take the bridge.

sense.name: a relative loss in price, value
sense.commentary: SACRIFICE[+quantity][+amount][+price][+reduction] Note: implies some sales price loss for a seller
sense.examples: The bankrupt store sold most of its remaining goods at a sacrifice. They had to sell their home at a considerable sacrifice.

sense.name: a ritually killed animal or human
sense.commentary: SACRIFICE[+entity][+individual][+victim][+killed][+ritually][+human/+animal] Note: refers to the entity, not the act of killing (Sense 6)
sense.examples: They offered a lamb as a sacrifice. The human sacrifices had their hearts torn from them. This is where sacrifices were offered to the spirits.

sense.name: a forfeiting game strategy
sense.examples: His bunt was a sacrifice to get the runner to second. Black's sacrifice of his queen was a trap that white fell for. (chess strategy) Mary decided to make a sacrifice bid in the bridge game.

sense.name: the act of performing a ritualized killing
sense.examples: The sacrifice of the sacred animals had to occur under a full moon. The grizzly sacrifice of the cult's children was on the front page of all the newspapers.
